Environment for showcasing self-hosted HTML, CSS and JavaScript snippets, with editable source. 

npm install coder
bower install coder
Download View on GitHub

Features

  • Lightweight: No dependencies, uses textareas for editing by default.
  • Plugins: Flexible plugin architecture for custom editors, preprocessors or anything else.
  • Code editors: Includes plugins for code editors like Ace and CodeMirror.
  • Preprocessors: Includes plugins for preprocessors (ES6, CoffeeScript, Less, Stylus, Markdown).

Browser support

  • Modern browsers
  • iOS 5+
  • Android 4+
  • IE 9+

Demos

  • Ace Editor - Using the Ace editor and plugin.
  • CodeMirror Editor - Using the CodeMirror editor and plugin.
  • Markdown - Using the Markdown plugin.
  • Less - Using the Less plugin.
  • Stylus - Using the Stylus plugin.
  • CoffeeScript - Using the CoffeeScript plugin.
  • ES2015 - Using the Babel plugin for ES6/2015 JavaScript support.
  • External files - Loading external files, instead of using inline content.
  • Console Plugin - Using the Console plugin, for a lightweight JavaScript console running in the iframe context.
  • Play Plugin - The Play plugin disables auto-run and adds a Run button to manually update the preview.
  • Pen Plugin - Different layout with the result on top, and side by side, resizable columns.
  • Bin Theme - Using the bin theme, for side by side editing.

How to use

Quick use


<p>
  Make sure you load <a href="https://codemirror.net/" target="_blank">CodeMirror</a> first.
</p>

<div id="coder-demo-codemirror"></div>

<link rel="stylesheet" href="./css/codemirror.css">


<link href="./css/coder.css" rel="stylesheet">

require([
  'skylark-widgets-coder'
], function (Coder) {

  new Coder(document.querySelector('#editor'), {
    files: [{
      type: 'html',
      url: 'index.html'
    }]
  })
});

</script>

Options

Initialize Coder with new Coder(elementNode, optionsHash).

The first argument is a DOM container where the editor will be created. The second argument is a hash of options.

Available options are:

files

Type: Array Default: []

Array of Objects specifying files that will be loaded. Objects inside the array must follow this pattern:

{
  type: "html", // can be "html", "css", or "js"
  url: "/index.html", // load the file from a url (restricted by the same-domain policy), OR
  content: "<h1>HTML Content</h1>" // insert file content as string
}

Use either url or content, not both.

showBlank

Type: Boolean Default: false

Specifies if panes/tabs without content/files should be visible.

runScripts

Type: Boolean Default: true

Specifies if script tags inside HTML content should be ran.

pane

Type: String Default: result

Specifies which pane/tab should be the default one opened. Can be result, html, css or js.

debounce

Type: Number Default: 250

Sets the debounce interval used by the change event (eg. render changes in the Result pane after a change in an editor).

plugins

Type: Array Default: []

Array of Strings or Objects setting the plugins used by this editor instance.

If String, specify plugin name.

If Object, follow this pattern:

{
  name: 'less', // plugin name
  options: {} // options hash to be passed to plugin
}

Example

new Coder(document.querySelector('#demo'), {
  files: [{
    type: 'css',
    url: 'index.styl'
  }, {
    type: 'html',
    content: '<h1>Demo</h1>'
  }],
  showBlank: true,
  plugins: [
    'stylus',
    {
      name: 'codemirror',
      options: {
        lineNumbers: false
      }
    }
  ]

Plugin API

For creating custom plugins see the docs on the Plugin API.

Source code available on GitHub: ghinda/coder.
